page.title: 18Communication-rural Sowerby
page.content: In such a scattered area communications are not easy, and almost every home has a telephone as a link with the outside world. Ordering for animal feeds, grain and other necessities can be done easily by telephone, as well as calling the Doctor, Vet, emergency services or just a social call. The car is also an essential method of communication and every home has one. The postman calls once a day, in the morning and will take any letters for posting, as well as delivering the daily post and possibly the newspaper. No newsagent would consider delivering to such outlying homes.
